pageContext.claim: “We are losing close to $100 billion a year on trade with Mexico, for many years. Not only that -- they have a tax of 17 percent. We don't have a tax. So they have a value-added tax of 17 percent. We don't have a tax of 17 percent.”
pageContext.analysis: Counting goods and services, the trade deficit with Mexico was $64.1 billion in 2017, according to the Office of the U.S. Trade Representative. Moreover, countries do not "lose" money on trade deficits -- or "make" it on trade surpluses.
